title: Senior Backend Developer — Exhaustive Atomic Action Plan
description: Alphabetically ordered, zero-padded, hyper-specific study & build tasks — all pulled from Speakap’s job description
items: 01- API Design: Build a versioned REST API (v1/) in Symfony with proper status codes, error payloads (RFC 7807), and HATEOAS links
02- AWS Lambda (PHP): Deploy a PHP function using Bref; trigger via API Gateway or SQS; handle cold starts gracefully
03- AWS S3: Upload/download objects via AWS SDK for PHP; generate pre-signed URLs; configure bucket policies for frontend uploads
04- AWS SQS: Send/receive messages between services; implement visibility timeout handling and dead-letter queues
05- Behat: Write a feature spec for user login flow (Given/When/Then); integrate with Symfony + Mink (REST context)
06- CI/CD (GitHub Actions): Automate lint (PHP-CS-Fixer), test (PHPUnit), build (Docker), and deploy (SSH) on push to main
07- DataDog APM: Instrument a Symfony app — trace requests, tag spans (env, version), log errors with context
08- Design Patterns: Implement Repository + Unit of Work (Doctrine) and Strategy (e.g., notification channel selector)
09- Docker: Multi-stage build for PHP 8.2 + Nginx + FPM; mount volumes for dev; expose ports, healthcheck endpoints
10- Elasticsearch: Index user activity logs via PHP client; write bool query for full-text search on messages/posts
11- Git Workflow: Practice rebase-merge workflow; write semantic commits (feat:, fix:, chore:); sign commits with GPG
12- Java 8/9 (Bonus): Run a simple Spring Boot service (e.g., auth proxy); call it from PHP via HTTP/gRPC (optional)
13- Linux CLI: Write a shell script that checks app health (curl + jq), restarts failed containers, and logs to /var/log
14- Lua (Bonus): Write an NGINX+OpenResty auth plugin (e.g., validate JWT in access_by_lua); test with curl
15- MySQL Optimization: Use EXPLAIN ANALYZE on slow queries; add composite indexes; avoid SELECT *; benchmark before/after
16- NGINX: Configure reverse proxy to PHP-FPM; add rate limiting (limit_req); set security headers (CSP, X-Content-Type-Options)
17- OAuth 2.0 / JWT: Issue access/refresh tokens (LexikJWTAuthenticationBundle); validate scopes in middleware; rotate keys
18- PHPUnit: Test service layer (mock dependencies with Prophecy); assert exception cases; generate coverage report
19- Redis: Cache API responses (e.g., GET /posts/{id}); implement tag-based invalidation; use Redis as session handler
20- Shell Scripting: Automate DB dump + S3 upload; parse logs for error patterns (grep + awk); notify on failure (curl → Slack)
21- SOLID Principles: Refactor a God-class service into SRP-compliant classes; apply LSP (subtypes), DIP (interfaces)
22- Symfony 6+: Use Messenger for async events; Validator for input; Serializer for DTOs; Console for CLI commands
23- TypeScript (ECMAScript 10+): Add strict typing to a Node.js utility (e.g., CSV parser); use ??, ?. , async generators
24- Automated Testing Culture: Add mutation testing (Infection); enforce test coverage threshold in CI
25- Security Hardening: Prevent SQLi (Doctrine param binding), XSS (output escaping), SSRF (block private IPs in cURL wrappers)
26- Performance Benchmarking: Simulate 1k RPM on /api/v1/posts with k6; identify bottlenecks (DB, serialization, network)
27- Agile Mindset: Run a personal “sprint” (1 week) — plan 3 atomic tasks, review, retro (what slowed you down?)
28- Clean Code Habits: Extract methods until no comment needed; name variables intention-revealing (e.g., $unreadMessageCount)
29- Collaboration Practice: Submit a PR with clear title, description, screenshots, and self-review notes — even on personal repo
